 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָאָה‎</span>] **verb** ==be weary, impatient== (compare Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***be slow, hesitating*** ([[BDB#Frey|Frey]]); <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***after difficulty***, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***with difficulty*** ([[BDB#Lane|Lane]]<sup>3007</sup>); Aramaic <span class="bdbLangAramaic">‎לְאִי‎</span>, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">); — 

**Qal** ***Imperfect*** 2 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תִּלְאֶה‎</span> [[Job.4.2|Job 4:2]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַתֵּ֑לֶא‎</span> [[Job.4.5|Job 4:5]] 3 plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיִּלְאוּ‎</span> [[Gen.19.11|Gen 19:11]] — ***be weary*** (in vain endeavour) followed by Infinitive [[Gen.19.11|Gen 19:11]] ***be weary, impatient*** at attempted consolation absolute [[Job.4.2|Job 4:2]] at calamity absolute [[Job.4.5|Job 4:5]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּהַל‎</span>). **Niph\`al** ***Perfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִלְאָה‎</span> [[Prov.26.15|Prov 26:15]] + 2 t.; 2 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִלְאֵית‎</span> [[Isa.47.13|Isa 47:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִלְאֵיתִי‎</span> [[Isa.1.14|Isa 1:14]] + 3 t., etc.; — followed by infinitive ***be weary*** of doing a thing, [[Exod.7.18|Exod 7:18]] ([[BDB#J|J]][[BDB#E|E]]), ***make oneself weary*** in doing something [[Prov.26.15|Prov 26:15]] (of sluggard's laziness), ***weary*** (i.e. strenuously exert) ***oneself*** to [[Jer.9.4|Jer 9:4]]; [[Jer.20.9|Jer 20:9]] absolute of eager and hopeless prayer <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עלהַֿבָּמָה‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִל‎</span> Moab, [[Isa.16.12|Isa 16:12]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִרְאָה‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בָּא אֶלמִֿקְדָּשׁוֺ לְהִתְפַּלֵּל‎</span>); of vain consultations, (followed by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּ‎</span>) Babylon [[Isa.47.13|Isa 47:13]] subject <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>, followed by infinitive [[Isa.1.14|Isa 1:14]]; [[Jer.6.11|Jer 6:11]]; [[Jer.15.6|Jer 15:6]], always of exhausted patience; figurative of parched soil (absolute) [[Ps.68.10|Ps 68:10]]. **Hiph\`il** ***Perfect*** 3 masculine singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶלְאָנִי‎</span> [[Job.16.7|Job 16:7]] 3 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶלְאָת‎</span> [[Ezek.24.12|Ezek 24:12]] (strike out [[BDB#Sept|ᵐ5]] [[BDB#Co|Co]]), 1 singular suffix <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הֶלְאֵתִיךָ‎</span> [[Mic.6.3|Mic 6:3]] ***Imperfect*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וַיַּלְאוּךָ‎</span> [[Jer.12.5|Jer 12:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎תַּלְאוּ‎</span> [[Isa.7.13|Isa 7:13]] ***Infinitiveconstruct*** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַלְאוֺת‎</span> [[Isa.7.13|Isa 7:13]] — ***weary, make weary, exhaust***, followed by accusative [[Job.16.7|Job 16:7]] (subject God); ***exhaust patience of***, object God [[Isa.7.13|Isa 7:13]] object men [[Isa.7.13|Isa 7:13]]; [[Jer.12.5|Jer 12:5]]; [[Mic.6.3|Mic 6:3]].
